verses.verse: And the Lord<WH3068> spoke<WH1696> unto Moses<WH4872> in the wilderness<WH4057> of Sinai<WH5514>, in the first<WH7223> month<WH2320> of the second<WH8145> year<WH8141> after they were come out<WH3318> of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, saying<WH559>,
Let the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> also keep<WH6213> the passover<WH6453> at his appointed season<WH4150>.

In the fourteenth<WH702> day<WH3117> of this month<WH2320>, at even<WH6153>, you shall keep<WH6213> it in his appointed season<WH4150>: according to all the rites<WH2708> of it<WH4941>, and according to all the ceremonies there<WH6213>, shall you keep it.
And Moses<WH4872> spoke<WH1696> unto the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, that they should keep<WH6213> the passover<WH6453>.

And they kept<WH6213> the passover<WH6453> on the fourteenth<WH702> day<WH3117> of the first<WH7223> month<WH2320> at even<WH6153> in the wilderness<WH4057> of Sinai<WH5514>: according to all that the Lord<WH3068> commanded<WH6680> Moses<WH4872>, so did<WH6213> the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>.

And there were certain men<WH582>, who were defiled<WH2931> by the dead body<WH5315> of a man<WH120>, that they could<WH3201> not keep<WH6213> the passover<WH6453> on that day<WH3117>: and they came<WH7126> before<WH6440> Moses<WH4872> and before<WH6440> Aaron<WH175> on that day<WH3117>:

And those<WH1992> men<WH582> said<WH559> unto him<WH2931>, We are defiled by the dead body<WH5315> of a man<WH120>: why are we kept back<WH1639>, that we may not offer<WH7126> an offering<WH7133> of the Lord<WH3068> in his appointed season<WH4150> among<WH8432> the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>?
And Moses<WH4872> said<WH559> unto them<WH5975>, Stand still, and I will hear<WH8085> what the Lord<WH3068> will command concerning you<WH6680>.
And the Lord<WH3068> spoke<WH1696> unto Moses<WH4872>, saying<WH559>,

Speak<WH1696> unto the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, saying<WH559>, If any<WH376> man<WH376> of you or of your posterity<WH1755> shall be unclean<WH2931> by reason of a dead body<WH5315>, or be in a journey<WH1870> afar off<WH7350>, yet he shall keep<WH6213> the passover<WH6453> unto the Lord<WH3068>.
The fourteenth<WH702> day<WH3117> of the second<WH8145> month<WH2320> at even<WH6153> they shall keep<WH6213> it<WH398>, and eat it with unleavened bread<WH4682> and bitter herbs<WH4844>.
They shall leave<WH7604> none of it unto the morning<WH1242>, nor break<WH7665> any bone<WH6106> of it<WH2708>: according to all the ordinances of the passover<WH6453> they shall keep it<WH6213>.

But the man<WH376> that is clean<WH2889>, and is not in a journey<WH1870>, and forbeareth<WH2308> to keep<WH6213> the passover<WH6453>, even the same soul<WH5315> shall be cut off<WH3772> from among his people<WH5971>: because he brought<WH7126> not the offering<WH7133> of the Lord<WH3068> in his appointed season<WH4150>, that man<WH376> shall carry<WH5375> his sin<WH2399>.

And if a stranger<WH1616> shall stay<WH1481> among you<WH6213>, and will keep the passover<WH6453> unto the Lord<WH3068>; according to the ordinance<WH2708> of the passover<WH6453>, and according to the manner<WH4941> there<WH6213>, so shall he do: you shall have one<WH259> ordinance<WH2708>, both for the stranger<WH1616>, and for him that was born<WH249> in the land<WH776>.

And on the day<WH3117> that the tabernacle<WH4908> was reared up<WH6965> the cloud<WH6051> covered<WH3680> the tabernacle<WH4908>, namely<WH168>, the tent of the testimony<WH5715>: and at even<WH6153> there was upon the tabernacle<WH4908> as it were the appearance<WH4758> of fire<WH784>, until the morning<WH1242>.
So it was always<WH8548>: the cloud<WH6051> covered<WH3680> it by day<WH4758>, and the appearance of fire<WH784> by night<WH3915>.

And when<WH6310> the cloud<WH6051> was taken up<WH5927> from the tabernacle<WH168>, then after<WH310> that the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> journeyed<WH5265>: and in the place<WH4725> where the cloud<WH6051> lived<WH7931>, there the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> pitched their tents<WH2583>.

At the commandment<WH6310> of the Lord<WH3068> the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> journeyed<WH5265>, and at the commandment<WH6310> of the Lord<WH3068> they pitched<WH2583>: as long as<WH3117> the cloud<WH6051> lived<WH7931> upon the tabernacle<WH4908> they rested in their tents<WH2583>.

And when the cloud<WH6051> stayed long<WH748> upon the tabernacle<WH4908> many<WH7227> days<WH3117>, then the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> kept<WH8104> the charge<WH4931> of the Lord<WH3068>, and journeyed not<WH5265>.

And so it was<WH3426>, when the cloud<WH6051> was a few<WH4557> days<WH3117> upon the tabernacle<WH4908>; according to the commandment<WH6310> of the Lord<WH3068> they lived<WH2583> in their tents<WH6310>, and according to the commandment of the Lord<WH3068> they journeyed<WH5265>.

And so it was<WH3426>, when the cloud<WH6051> lived from even<WH6153> unto the morning<WH1242>, and that the cloud<WH6051> was taken up<WH5927> in the morning<WH1242>, then they journeyed<WH5265>: whether it was by day<WH3119> or by night<WH3915> that the cloud<WH6051> was taken up<WH5927>, they journeyed<WH5265>.

Or whether it were two days<WH3117>, or a month<WH2320>, or a year<WH3117>, that the cloud<WH6051> stayed<WH748> upon the tabernacle<WH4908>, remaining<WH7931> on it<WH1121>, the sons of Israel<WH3478> lived<WH2583> in their tents<WH5265>, and journeyed not<WH5927>: but when it was taken up, they journeyed<WH5265>.

At the commandment<WH6310> of the Lord<WH3068> they rested<WH2583> in the tents<WH6310>, and at the commandment of the Lord<WH3068> they journeyed<WH5265>: they kept<WH8104> the charge<WH4931> of the Lord<WH3068>, at the commandment<WH6310> of the Lord<WH3068> by the hand<WH3027> of Moses<WH4872>.
